page.title: 01WEST TANFIELD
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF WEST TANFIELD IS SITUATED ON THE NORTH BANK OF THE RIVER URE, SIX MILES FROM THE CITY OF RIPON ON THE A6108. THE VILLAGE HAS GROWN UP ON THE HIGHER GROUND ABOVE THE RIVER URE WHICH OCCASIONALLY FLOODED THE SURROUNDING LAND. THE VILLAGE IS APPROACHED FROM THE SOUTH ACROSS A GRACEFUL THREE ARCHED STONE BRIDGE. THE AREA IS BASICALLY AGRICULTURAL, A LARGE PROPORTION OF THE LAND GIVEN OVER TO ARABLE CULTIVATION, THE MAIN CROPS BEING BARLEY, WHEAT AND POTATOES. FORAGE CROPS OF HAY AND SILAGE ARE GROWN IN EARLY SUMMER FOR THE WINTERING OF SHEEP, DAIRY COWS AND FAT CATTLE. THE AREA WAS HEAVILY GLACIATED IN THE ICE AGE AND THIS HAS RESULTED IN GOOD DEPOSITS OF GRAVEL WHICH IS NOW QUARRIED FOR INDUSTRIAL USE.
